snippet: In insisting on access to suspected nuclear sites like Parchin, six world powers signaled a unified resolve in renewed negotiations with Iran, which were suspended in frustration more than a year ago.
abstract: Six member countries of the United Nations Security Council that have agreed to resume negotiations with Iran over its disputed nuclear program issue a blunt request that Iran allow international inspectors unfettered access, most notably to Parchin, a large restricted military complex that the inspectors suspect may house a testing chamber for explosives used in atomic weapons triggers.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and WILLIAM J. BROAD

lead_paragraph: In insisting on access to suspected nuclear sites like Parchin, six world powers signaled a unified resolve in renewed negotiations with Iran, which were suspended in frustration more than a year ago.

headline.seo: Iran Pressed to Give Nuclear Inspectors Full Access to Sites
headline.main: Iran Is Pressed on Access for Nuclear Inspectors
headline.print_headline: Iran Is Pressed on Access For Nuclear Inspectors
